signalslinkep:usageinfo-signalslinkep-ti: SignalsLink.EP - Cooperation between the Signals and Electrical Progressive mods
signalslinkep:usageinfo-signalslinkep-te:
SignalsLink.EP<\/strong><\/font>
Expands the Signals<\/a> mod with components cooperating with the Electrical Progressive<\/a> mod.

Electrical Progressive<\/strong><\/font>
EP Switch<\/strong>
A switch controlled by a signal. It allows enabling or disabling the transmission of electrical current.
If there is a signal at the input, the switch is ON. If there is no signal at the input, the switch is OFF.
EP Meter<\/strong>
Allows obtaining information about the state of the electrical network the meter is connected to.
If the input signal is 1, the output signal shows the battery charge status in the network.
If the input signal is 2, the output signal shows the production/consumption balance. Values 1-7: consumption exceeds charging, 8: consumption=production, 9-15: electricity production exceeds consumption.
If the input is any other signal, the output is signal 0.
